intro: Hieracium acrifoliiforme, commonly known as the prickly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in stiff, prickly hairs. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium acrifoliiforme is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, thriving in sunny conditions.
